text.0: he who gives food like patrimonial riches and guides aright like some wise mans instruction.
text.1: loved like a guest who lies in pleasant lodgingmay he as priest prosper his servants dwelling.
text.2: he who like savitar the god trueminded protecteth with his power all acts of vigour.
text.3: truthful like splendour glorified by many like breath joygivingall must strive to win him.
text.4: he who on earth dwells like a king surrounded by faithful friends like a god allsustaining.
text.5: like heroes who preside who sit in safety like as a blameless dame dear to her husband.
text.6: thee such in settlements secure o agni our men serve ever kindled in each dwelling.
text.7: on him have they laid splendour in abundance dear to all men bearer be he of riches.
text.8: may thy rich worshippers win food o agni and princes gain long life who bring oblation.
text.9: may we get booty from our foe in battle presenting to the gods their share for glory.
text.10: the cows of holy law sent us by heaven have swelled with laden udders loudly lowing.
text.11: soliciting his favour from a distance the rivers to the rock have flowed together.
text.12: agni with thee soliciting thy favour the holy ones have gained glory in heaven.
text.13: they made the night and dawn of different colours and set the black and purple hues together.
text.14: may we and those who worship be the mortals whom thou o agni leadest on to riches.
text.15: thou hast filled earth and heaven and airs midregion and followest the whole world like a shadow.
text.16: aided by thee o agni may we conquer steeds with steeds men with men heroes with heroes.
text.17: lords of the wealth transmitted by our fathers and may our princes live a hundred winters.
text.18: may these our hymns of praise agni ordainer be pleasant to thee in thy heart and spirit.
text.19: may we have power to hold thy steeds of riches laying on thee the godsent gift of glory.
